ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: Survey Time Point (in seconds)
Mean of normal-to-normal interval (NN) time series
Normal-to-normal Interquartile range
Kurtosis of normal-to-normal interval time series
Skewness of normal-to-normal interval time series
Standard deviation of normal-to-normal intervals
Root-mean square differences of successive R-R intervals.
Mean number of times per hour in which the change in consecutive NN intervals exceeds 50 milliseconds.
Phase Rectified Signal Averaging - Acceleration Capacity (AC)
Phase Rectified Signal Averaging - Deceleration Capacity (DC)
Power in the High Frequency band (0.15-0.4Hz)
Power in the Low Frequency band (0.04-0.15Hz)
Total Power: Sum of power from ULF, VLF, LF and HF bands
Ratio of LF to HF power
Sample Entropy of RR interval
Approximate Entropy
Average Signal-Quality-Index within the current window
Data file 1
type of data file 1
data file 1 category
Notes: HRV=heart rate variability daily data file per participant; Annotation=Corresponding annotation file with metadata information

ElementDescription: Data file 2
data file 2 type/description
data file 2 category
Notes: HRV=heart rate variability daily data file per participant; Annotation=Corresponding annotation file with metadata information
